documents.document: @roddrury @garethmorgannz @TheSpinoffTV Gareth, apart from "investing" in land, where are the other benefits that TOP seems to require?
@roddrury @garethmorgannz @TheSpinoffTV New Zealand has clear citizenship rules that should apply equally to everyone.
@HalfOnionInABag better half an onion than a whole orange!
@FlickElectricCo @FastCompany imagine if you could just 3D print an entire outfit at home. Then reuse the materials to print another one.
@ladyleet don't eat them all at once! #johnnyCash
@RaybonKan he should turn the other cheek and offer himself for some torture.
@Vicki_Scarlett @sarahmei were they an effective sales team? I'd expect them to be crap if they are that blind to other perspectives.
@hadyngreen @consumernz I have a 2.8L inline 6. But I'm Wellington.
@HalfOnionInABag makes me cry. But so does @realDonaldTrump
@StackPodcast Data is a robot on Star Trek. #StackOverflowPodcast
@Grady_Booch @PressSec likely a collection of Grimm's fairy tales.
@RaybonKan what if there are no virgins?
@jbrains unless the book is "little miss happy". That is an absolute precondition for me ;)
@haruki_zaemon @martinfowler that tells me the decisions are being made too early.
@StackPodcast is it the bug or the submitter who is not reproducible? Con. #StackOverflowPodcast
@jurmarcusallen @grmpyprogrammer trickle up economics, on the other hand, does seem to work.
@grmpyprogrammer @jurmarcusallen I believe trickle down economics was proven not to work a few decades ago.
@RaybonKan @SteveKingIA while trump will be a nightmare, at least our comedians will have material for several decades :)
@jbrains @ImaginaryTime I still use zip lock bags - Anova is my 3rd sous vide cooker (built my first one!).
@ImaginaryTime @jbrains nice. Creme Brûlée is also great in a water bath. I bought modernist cooking at home. Lots of ideas in there.
@jbrains no I mean 68 for 48 hours.
@ImaginaryTime @jbrains do you put them in one water bath at different temperatures for fun?
@jbrains I have one of those. It is awesome. Brisket at 56 Celsius for 48 hours yum.
@FlickElectricCo power back on. Candles are now out.
@Grady_Booch @IBM @cdixon does this mean that a bee beat us at chess and go? Bugger.
@FlickElectricCo oddly we did have fish and chips for dinner. Home made. While still had power. Young kids so eat early.
@FlickElectricCo already rang your help desk. Should be back on at 9:30. Pinehaven Upper Hutt.
@FlickElectricCo @futurism I'd rather that my power doesn't go out in a storm. Like right now!
@daryllgray @adidasNZ report them to the DIA for spam.
@buildmaster we got a Honda CR-V. Works very well. But only 5 seats.
@MrKrisViking @_youhadonejob1 there was another one on the other side of the uni that says "this university is shit" but it got removed.
@MrKrisViking @_youhadonejob1 NZ is a young country. Not many old trees. I find the plaque nice that someone cared that much.
@MrKrisViking @_youhadonejob1 this plaque is at Victoria university in Wellington New Zealand. I remember the tree. It was nice.
@sarahmei @jessethanley coding is complex and hard. I think it is ok to blame your tools once in a while :)
@sarahmei @jessethanley and yes - I saw it as a jab at people who value tools as well.
@sarahmei @jessethanley some things need the right tool. Cutting ripe tomatoes with a blunt knife. Refactoring legacy code with notepad.
@sarahmei @jessethanley all the pros I know use great tools. Programmers, carpenters, chefs... a pro knows the value of tools.
@funkatron @grmpyprogrammer sex robots will be cheaper so will prob be widespread first. But likely will converge on widespread sex cars.
@evanlong @joemccann if all good devs are hacking in holidays, I am happy to be a bad developer and have a life.
@thomasfuchs @grmpyprogrammer if amazon built self driving cars they would say: "people who went to your house also visited the pub"
Proud to be the 14,966th backer on @BackerKit for Font Awesome 5 | Thx @fontawesome! https://t.co/demkzbxSzR
@tjh remember to return the driver too.
@ThePracticalDev I once had to build a fake progress bar because the product owner thought the system was too fast.
@RaybonKan @nzherald good points. Also, darth Vader doesn't exist :)
@AnovaCulinary @greytownnz here is another photo. https://t.co/urBmm3VhCn
@AnovaCulinary spare ribs from the @greytownnz butcher. 3 days at 56...will be a great Christmas lunch... https://t.co/9gKzO3QypF
@RonJeffries had this once. Think I deleted the account in messages and added it back.
@Grady_Booch @transition2017 @techmilind or a word document.
@skepticalhumor could make a good talk at the next java users group John...
@grmpyprogrammer we always praise effort and try to avoid praising talent or cuteness :) swimming lessons in New Zealand aren't so intense
@TimbuktuMag so proud of the colour scheme my 6 year old chose for herself for the queen! https://t.co/bW6iMY2ert
@buildmaster @8iReality @nikz I am virtually there.
@RaybonKan @hcirePT @nzherald that column is worth at least $2300.
@ThePracticalDev a good pillow and mattress. #devdiscuss
@ThePracticalDev the tooling will always lag the new hot languages
@grmpyprogrammer I know this feeling only too well. It sucks.
@buildmaster they are awesome. Kickstarter it!
@martinfowler @Grady_Booch count me in on this as well.
@rachelmaleady @StackPodcast peanut butter? In NZ Jif is a kitchen cleaning product.
@HiranThabrew @ICBM2016 awesome! Lots of computer science research about making sticky websites. Outcomes harder. https://t.co/e5p69eNCcp
@jbrains @Englishbobster eating an elephant: one bite at a time.
@jbrains @juanmirod I have: test after; end to end; dep injection of mocks; testing implemention v behaviour; that's all that fits in a twee
@juanmirod @jbrains has anyone looked at the stages people go through when learning TDD?
@deadlyllama I agree with Elouise here. Because awesome dreaming magnadoodle.
This verdict leaves me speechless. Dumbfounded. Shoot someone in the back and get off? How? https://t.co/xFqrbsSfgH
@mogest @buildmaster it is probably more Owen's bulging muscles.
@troubleisbrewng easy. Don't go outside.
@troubleisbrewng I am having #weedstock at my place this year.
@FireflyCinema I hear there is a movie too!
@grmpyprogrammer one of my friends watched Fox News for a year before realising It was not a satire.
@grmpyprogrammer strange how "talk to other people" is not on the list. Glad the phishing one is - the rest don't seem interesting.
@amelialaundy Depending on required features, an F5 might work. (sry about lots of tweets - you asked an interesting question!)
@amelialaundy AWS API Gateway does have a redirect to arbitrary URL feature - configurable per method on each endpo… https://t.co/32qpSBoD7O
@amelialaundy they can redirect I think. My point was more - this is a problem others have solved. Building these is hard :)
@amelialaundy why not use an existing service - AWS has an awesome one.
@grmpyprogrammer @CBCNews protect identity of main suspect so they get a fair trial? But usually so family can be notified.
@kaelle76 @rogerpfaff I thought for a second "this has to be satire". Apparently not. WTF. #dcmuc16
@deadlyllama Yeah, that should be much more restrictive than business filtering. And not just porn - also self harm websites, etc, etc.
@YitzOfTheBits @grmpyprogrammer No. Unit tests for validation, bus logic, DB, factories, etc. Then 1 local end2end test (incl local DB)
@pageofwords new books! https://t.co/k7Qvfld2Sz
@deadlyllama unsavoury is difficult because one person's unsavoury is not another persons. So ISPs might avoid that. But who knows!
@farnamstreet @Grady_Booch or, having just googled, I might be wrong about that.
@farnamstreet @Grady_Booch @amazon pity homework doesn't increase educational outcomes. But alexia prob doesn't know that!
@grmpyprogrammer and component based react front end makes test driving components also nice.
@grmpyprogrammer testing a small bit of code that responds to a well defined interface in a well defined way is nice.
@grmpyprogrammer I have just finished a big serverless app TDD. Worked beautifully.
@deadlyllama that is very sensible. What content blocking facilities are you after? Malware or unsavoury?
@deadlyllama use any of the major ones. Most of the time they don't work so are blocking everything by default ;)
@maxwellstrachan @RaybonKan reminds me how trivial first world problems are. Growing up we had to sell lemonade to our sheep.
@benjammingh Wellington try datacom or catalyst - they do lots of infra and are usually hiring. (I am from welly and it is awesome)
@NASAWebb gravity is what keeps me escaping from a hole. So it seems aptly named. Is it black?
@jbrains I am completely dumbfounded. This is odd. Am interested to know the root cause!
As usual @RaybonKan is awesome. https://t.co/XqNh0bHAqr
@Grady_Booch @NateSilver538 this sequence of tweets made me laugh. https://t.co/sgWR4Oj4Ie
@Grady_Booch a small one. I was in a 7.8 last week ;) but really, hope everything is ok.
@buildmaster consider yourself hit :)
@billmckibben @Grady_Booch this graph gives me the shivers. What have we given our grandkids.
@deadlyllama they all should.
@_youhadonejob1 great for watching paint dry.
@newtron hey - what remote options do you have. I am in New Zealand!
